translated: The Buddha Speaks the MahÄ-vidyÄ-siddhi-vidhi of Vajra-gandha Bodhisattva
Scroll 2
Tripiá¹­aka Master from the Western Regions, Chao-san-ta-fu Shih-hung-lu
Qing Chuan-fa Ta-shi Shi Hu-hu Respectfully Translated by Imperial Order Next, the method of binding and subduing is performed.
First, draw Vajra-gandha Bodhisattva.
Make the appearance complete, with a yellow body.
Emitting great radiance, illuminating the realm of space.
Standing on the peak of a great mountain, treading on the image of a hated enemy with the feet.
The practitioner, in front of this image, performs visualization.
Having attained the presence [of the deity],
all hated enemies are completely bound and subdued.
Furthermore, on the hanging scroll,
draw Vajra-gandha Bodhisattva as before.
Make offerings with excellent fragrant flowers.
Use realgar, pure soil, and water to mix into mud.
Make an image of the hated enemy.
The practitioner, in front of the bodhisattva hanging scroll,
holds a five-pronged vajra scepter with the hands.
With an angry appearance, step on the hated enemy.
Recite the great vidyÄ one thousand times.
All enemies will be completely subdued.
Furthermore, use yellow wax to make an effigy of the enemy.
The practitioner steps on it with the left foot and makes visualizations.
That enemy will be within a hundred thousand yojanas.
Again, visualize the sages and saints filling the entire sky.
Once this visualization appears,
that enemy will naturally become foolish and unable to harm.
If this accomplishment method is used towards the buddhas,
even the buddhas will not wish to disobey.
How much less so all sages, saints, humans, non-humans, and others.

HÄ« bhagavÄn mahÄvajra-gá¹›dhri lÄ« HÄ hÄ hÄ hÅ«á¹ƒ phaá¹­ svÄhÄ By reciting this mantra, one can accomplish all things.
It can destroy all enemies.
It also explains the method of accomplishment.
On the first day of the month, or the first seven days, or the first eight days,
The practitioner eats red food and wears clean clothes.
Recite the great mantra a thousand times or a hundred times.
If one experiences horripilation,
Or in the night one sees various auspicious dreams,
After that, one should perform the method according to Vajra-GandhapÄda.
All will be accomplished.
If one wishes to cause brahmins to have respect and affection,
Use fresh butter to make an image of a brahmin.
Recite the great mantra eight hundred times.
Empower white mustard seeds by reciting the name of the brahmin.
If you strike the image with white mustard seeds, they will be respectful and loving.
Furthermore, use salt and empower it 800 times.
Recite the name of the vaiÅ›ya.
For each recitation of the name, recite the great mantra once.
Use salt to strike the image once.
That vaiÅ›ya will be respectful and loving.
Furthermore, use black beans and recite the great mantra to empower them 800 times.
Use charcoal ash to make a Å›Å«dra image.
Then, for each recitation of the great mantra, recite their name once.
Throw a bean at the image once, completing 800 times.
They will come themselves and be respectful and loving.
Next, the root great mantra and mudrÄ of Vajra-gandhabodhisattva are explained.
With both hands, make the vajra fist.
Cross the two little fingers.ğŸ”½Cross the two index fingers like a hook.
Extend the two thumbs to form the mudrÄ.
This mudrÄ has great power.
It can accomplish all supreme matters.
It can destroy all enemies.
All gods and humans, up to the lunar mansions,
Upon seeing this mudrÄ, one will be frightened and on the verge of death.
Only by chanting the Buddha's name can one seek protection.
Then, he spoke the fundamental great mantra, saying:ğŸ”½Oá¹ƒ namo bhagavate mahÄvajra-uá¹£á¹‡Ä«á¹£a indra, vajra vajra, agni agni, saá¹ƒbhava saá¹ƒbhava, siddha raká¹£a hÅ«á¹ƒ phaá¹­.
He further spoke the summoning mudrÄ.
Do not untie the previous mudrÄ.
With the two index fingers like hooks, move and shake to form the mudrÄ.
This mudrÄ can summon all devas, nÄgas, yaká¹£as, rÄká¹£asas,
and all ghosts and spirits, as well as the lunar mansions and so forth.
They will all come and become servants.
Even if there are bodhisattvas,
who hear this great mantra summoning,
Will arrive in an instant.

Then, he spoke the mantra for summoning the great vidyÄ:ğŸ”½Oá¹ƒ namo bhagavate mahÄvajra-gÄndhÄrÄ«-hÄ« hÄ« agaccha agaccha mama samayam samaya-maá¹‡á¸ala-vajrapÄá¹‡i-vajra-bhÄá¹‡ini-raá¹‡i-pÄá¹‡i-há¹› hÄ hÄ hÄ hÄ hÄ la la la la la ho
If there are practitioners
Who wish to perform various beneficial activities,
Having constructed the maá¹‡á¸ala,
If they wish to invite the principal deity Vajra-GandhÄri Bodhisattva,
They should recite this mantra and form the mudrÄ to summon the bodhisattva.
The practitioner should then, in front of the maá¹‡á¸ala,
Close their eyes and visualize the bodhisattva.
In an instant, the bodhisattva will arrive.
When the Bodhisattva comes, he manifests a wrathful appearance.
He has six faces with fangs protruding.
His various adornments and radiance are as blazing as the rising sun.
He has a hundred arms, each holding a weapon.
He has the appearance of wanting to destroy all enemies.
The practitioner, knowing that the Bodhisattva has come,
Immediately imagines offering him a jeweled lotus flower seat.
After the Bodhisattva sits,
He observes and knows that the practitioner is endowed with true intentions.
He then expounds for him the subtle samÄdhi of all Buddhas.
After the practitioner hears it, he joyfully bows in thanks.
Next, he expounds the samÄdhi mudrÄ.
With both hands, form the vajra-clasped-palms.
Extend the two thumbs and two little fingers, crossing them.
The two index fingers form a ring, completing the mudrÄ.
If one forms this mudrÄ, the samÄdhi will manifest.

Use the two thumbs to pinch the fingernails of the two index fingers, forming a ring.
Always bathing the Buddhas and sages.
Forming this mudra, recite the mantra:

12. Nilakantha
This is the great mantra.
In the Buddha family, it is like the bright moon.
It can destroy all evil darkness.
It can also protect the Buddha's teachings and remove all obstacles.
Next, it explains the accomplishment ritual of the great vajra-incense bodhisattva.
As before, recite the great mantra 8,000 times to become proficient.
Then, recite the mantra to empower aloeswood incense.
When this incense smoke touches anyone,
they will all be able to speak good and evil after being awakened.
If there are those who are possessed by devas, humans, or yakshas, they will all be able to be released.
Even those who are possessed by impure ghosts, those who cause hot fevers, malaria, and minor ghosts,
will be quickly released upon merely reciting the great mantra.
If one wishes to cause all of them to be awakened,
One must also establish a boundary to protect oneself.
And protect those who enter and awaken.
All the evil stars and planets that cause disasters,
Reciting this great mantra will also quickly make them retreat and dissolve.
One can accomplish one's own affairs and break the mantras of others.
All difficult matters will be accomplished.
This is the power of the great mantra, all will be accomplished as one wishes.
Next, if there is a practitioner,
Who wishes to perform various accomplishment methods,
The practitioner should be clean and always eat red-colored food.
Then prepare various incense and flowers.
Make offerings to the Buddha and one's deity.
Begin on the first day of the bright fortnight.
For seven days and nights, recite the great mantra 8,000 times.
After performing the preliminary practices,
All subsequent activities will be accomplished.
If one wishes to perform acts of endearment,
One should recite the great mantra while calling the other's name, and one will gain endearment.
If one recites the great mantra 8,000 times and empowers white mustard seeds,
Those touched by mustard seeds will all be respected and loved.
If one recites the great mantra 8,000 times and empowers wheat,
those touched by the wheat will be respected and loved.
If one wishes for the respect and love of Brahmins,
recite the great mantra 8,000 times and empower charcoal ash.
Sprinkle it on the Brahmins and they will themselves respect and love you.
If one recites the great mantra 8,000 times and empowers oil,
give it to the Vaishyas and they will themselves respect and love you.
If one recites the great mantra 8,000 times and empowers salt,
give it to the Shudras and they will themselves respect and love you.
If there is a noble couple who are not harmonious,
recite the great mantra 8,000 times.
Empower white mustard seeds and use them to touch their bodies.
They will then become harmonious and mutually respect and love each other.
If one recites the great mantra and empowers willow branches,
use them as toothpicks for a year.
One will then have everything one says be truthful.
One's speech will be without stammering.
If a soldier recites the great mantra seven times,
If one empowers one's hair, one will be victorious in battle.
If one recites the mantra and empowers white mustard seeds to perform homa,
one will obtain the respect and love of all.
If one recites the mantra and empowers sesame seeds to perform homa,
one will obtain all kinds of increase and benefit.
If one recites the mantra and empowers ghee to perform homa,
one will be able to extinguish all calamities.
If one recites the mantra and empowers milk to perform homa,
one will be able to prevent cattle, horses, and other livestock from suffering from epidemics.
Next, the mudra of Bodhisattva Mamki is explained.
If there are any past celestial bodies
that cause disasters to sentient beings,
the practitioner should stand and perform a dancing gesture,
imagining it to be like nailing a vajra stake.
Holding the vajra in the right hand and placing it at the side of the waist forms the mudra.
When all past celestial bodies see this mudra,
the disasters they create will all retreat and disperse.
Moreover, without changing the previous dancing gesture,
With the index fingers of both hands hooked, extend the left foot.
This is called the all-embracing mudrÄ.
This mudrÄ can accomplish all things.
Next, speak of Vajra-gandha Bodhisattva.
Contemplate the appearance of the root mantra syllables and place them on various parts of the body.
If the practitioner wishes to contemplate the appearance of the syllables,
first stand with the body in the right dance posture, the mind dwelling in samÄdhi.
With both hands form the vajra hook and place it above the heart.
This is the constant mudrÄ of Vajra-gandha Bodhisattva.
If one wishes to contemplate the adornment of the root mantra syllables,
one should contemplate Vajra-gandha Bodhisattva.
Or contemplate one's own body as that Vajra-gandha Bodhisattva.
Once the body appears,ğŸ”½contemplate the two syllables he he appearing on the two feet.

Next, contemplate the two syllables hÄ« hÄ« appearing at the mouth.
Next, visualize the two syllables hÅ«á¹ƒ and phaá¹­ appearing above the head.
Next, visualize the two syllables krauá¹ƒ and ha appearing on the two hands.
Next, visualize the two syllables krauá¹ƒ and ha as a smiling face.
Next, visualize the two syllables hÅ«á¹ƒ and hÅ«á¹ƒ are able to cause others to come and perform service.

The syllable ha is the weapon.
This method of visualizing wisdom.
All mantra practitioners who wish to recite mantras and seek accomplishments,
First, one must practice and become proficient in these two kinds of insight meditation.
Then, recite the root mantra.
Complete one lakh recitations as a preliminary practice.
When the number of recitations is complete,
one may then perform various accomplishment rituals.
If one wishes to accomplish all matters and perform homa,
use karavÄ«ra wood as firewood to light the fire.
Use ghee and recite the mantra 800 times.
Perform homa to accomplish what is to be accomplished.
This method can cause all within the three realms to be brought into awakening.
Come and dwell in the midst of empty space.
Speak of past, future, and present matters.
Or else, smear cow bezoar on a square maá¹‡á¸ala.
Place bowls in the four corners.
Place various images in the center.
Or vases, bells, and so forth.
Grind red sandalwood to anoint the bodies of the images and bells, etc.
Then burn frankincense and recite the mantra one thousand times.
The bell will then enter into awakening.
Then, form the vajra seal again and make a wrathful appearance.
Recite the syllable hÅ«á¹ƒ in a loud voice.
At that moment, a voice in the sky will speak of the affairs of the three times.
If one burns durÄlabhÄ incense,
and recites the root great mantra a thousand times,
even in a great river, mountain, or large mountain,
one can also shake and manifest the appearance of entering awakening.
If one places a skull in the maá¹‡á¸ala,
and the practitioner recites the great mantra a thousand times,
burns agalloch incense, makes a wrathful appearance, and recites the syllable hÅ«á¹ƒ in a loud voice,
the skull will then enter into awakening, rise up, leave the maá¹‡á¸ala,
and dwell in the sky, speaking of good and bad things.
Moreover, at a place where there is a treasure,
smear a maá¹‡á¸ala with cow dung that has not fallen on the ground.
Burn agalloch incense on the upper center,
and recite the great mantra a thousand times.
The practitioner makes a wrathful appearance and forms the wrathful seal.
